summary: Background Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) originated in china in 2002. it spread to 26 provinces in mainland china and 32 countries across five continents in a matter of months. however, the spatial features and potential determinants of SARS input-output flows remain unclear. differences were the major cause of the flows between pairs of regions. railway capacity, PGDP, and urban rate played important roles. electronic supplementary material available to authorized users.
